de.polygonal.ds.LinkedQueue

type
class
implements
Queue<T>
A queue based on a linked list. A queue is a linear list for which all insertions are made at one end of the list; all deletions (and usually all accesses) are made at the other end.
This is called a FIFO structure (First In, First Out).
See http://lab.polygonal.de/2007/05/23/data-structures-example-the-queue-class/

Constructor

new(?maxSize : Int)
parameters
maxSize The maximum allowed size of the queue. The default value of -1 does not impose a size constraint.

Instance Methods

assign(x : Dynamic, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?limit : Int) : Void

parameters
x If x is a class reference, the queue is filled with instances of the specified class and the args parameter is used to pass additional constructor arguments. If x is an object or a primitive value, the object reference or the value of x is assigned instead.
limit If specified, the queue is filled with n=limit elements, otherwise the queue is filled from 0 to size(). Existing elements are preserved if limit < size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError limit out of range (if debug flag is set).
Assigns new content to the queue by replacing elements with x.

back() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Queue is empty (if debug flag is set).
Returns the rear element (the 'youngest' element).

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this queue.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this queue.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this queue contains the element x.

dequeue() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Queue is empty (if debug flag is set).
Dequeues and returns x.

enqueue(x : T) : Void

Enqueues x.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this queue is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this queue.

maxSize() : Int

The maximum allowed size of the queue. Once the maximum size is reached, enqueuing an element will fail with an error (if debug flag is set). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound. Always returns -1 if debug flag is not set.

peek() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Queue is empty (if debug flag is set).
Returns the front element.

shuffle(?rval : Vector<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval A list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError rval is null or insufficient random values (if debug flag is set).
Shuffles the elements of this queue using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. If rval is not given, Math.random() is used, otherwise random values are taken from the specified rval array.

size() : Int

The total number of elements.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array ordered by the FIFO rule. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var lq = new de.polygonal.ds.LinkedQueue();
	  lq.enqueue(0);
	  lq.enqueue(1);
	  lq.enqueue(2);
	  trace(lq); //output:

	  {LinkedQueue size: 3}
	  |<
	    0 -> 0
	    1 -> 1
	    2 -> 2
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector ordered by the FIFO rule. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.
